values.name: stance-defensive
values.description: Defensive unit stance (unit chases a little, before returning to position)

values.name: stance-stand-ground
values.description: Units do not move from position

ClassId.description: Unit, building, Gaia, and resource classes

values.name: tame-animals-class
values.description: Tame (non-attacking) gaia animals, like deer and horses

values.name: moderate
values.description: The difficulty of a novice player

values.name: hard
values.description: The difficulty of an experienced player

values.name: hardest
values.description: The hardest difficulty in the game. AI's might cheat

values.name: ability-to-dodge-missiles
values.description: Chance of a computer player's unit dodging a missile (range: 0-100, default: 100)

values.name: ability-to-maintain-distance
values.description: Chance that a computer player's ranged unit will maintain the distance from enemy units whilst under attack (range: 0-100, default:100)

values.name: ally
values.description: Player(s) that are allied to computer player

values.name: enemy
values.description: Player(s) that are enemied to computer player

values.name: neutral
values.description: Player(s) that are neutral to coputer player

values.name: explored-yes
values.description: Point explored, but not currently visible

FindPlayerMethod.description: Defines which method for player searches

values.name: find-ordered
values.description: (?) Find next player in a given category

values.name: ALL-TECHS-ENABLED
values.description: True if full tech tree is available

values.name: FEUDAL-AGE-START
note: Assumes barracks requirement has been met for archery-range/stable
Assumes mill requirement has been met for farms/markets
All dark-age techs are already researched

values.name: CASTLE-AGE-START
note: Assumes blacksmith requirement has been met for seige workshop
All dark-age and feudal-age techs are already researched

values.name: IMPERIAL-AGE-START
note: Assumes castle requirement has been met for all things that require one
All dark, feudal, and castle-age techs are already researched

values.name: POST-IMPERIAL-AGE-START
note: Assumes castle requirement has been met for all things that require one
All techs available to players civ are already researched

values.name: GAIA
values.description: Checks if computer is playing as GAIA

values.name: HIGH-RESOURCES-START
values.description: Resource level setting is set to high
note: No effect in Regicide or Death Match game
Starting Res: food=1000, wood=1000, gold=700, stone=800
Defend the Wonder: food=1700, wood=1700, gold=1500, stone=1500

values.name: LOW-RESOURCES-START
values.description: Resource level setting is set to low
note: No effect in Regicide or Death Match game
Starting Res: food=200, wood=200, gold=100, stone=200
Defend the Wonder: food=900, wood=900, gold=900, stone=900

values.name: MEDIUM-RESOURCES-START
values.description: Resource level setting is set to medium
note: No effect in Regicide or Death Match game
Starting Res: food=500, wood=500, gold=300, stone=400
Defend the Wonder: food=1200, wood=1200, gold=1100, stone=1100

values.name: REGICIDE
values.description: Start with 1 king, 1 castle, 7 extra villagers, special starting resource amounts
note: Starting resources: food=500, wood=500, gold=0, stone=150

values.name: REVEAL-NORMAL
values.description: Defined if Reveal Map is set to "Normal"

values.name: REVEAL-EXPLORED
values.description: Defined if Reveal Map is set to "Explored"

values.name: REVEAL-ALL-VISIBLE
values.description: Defined if Reveal Map is set to "All Visible"

values.name: TEAMS-LOCKED
values.description: Defined when teams are locked. Alliance changes are disabled

values.name: TEAM-TOGETHER
values.description: Players are place in a clockwise rotation depending on player number

values.name: WONDER-RACE
values.description: Wonder Race system symbol. No combat; the first player to build a Wonder wins.

IdleType.description: List of civilian idle unit IDs

values.name: arabia
values.description: Notoriously open map with resources more thinly spread.

values.name: archipelago
values.description: A series of islands surrounded by a large ocean.

values.name: arena
values.description: The walls around your forest clearing are the only protection from the carnage in the middle.

values.name: baltic
values.description: A sea surrounded by a medium-sized piece of land on all sides.

values.name: black-forest
values.description: A very closed off map due to the high volume of trees.

values.name: coastal
values.description: On average, half-water and half-land, with reduced resources on land.

values.name: continental
values.description: A circular, giant island, surrounded by water.

values.name: crater-lake
values.description: An island brimming with gold in the center of a caldera lake. Steep elevation and lack of trees make it hard to build there.

values.name: fortress
values.description: A walled city with gates and all the buildings you need to build up your forces quickly.

values.name: gold-rush
values.description: A whole heap of gold and a few wolves in the middle of a desert.

values.name: highland
values.description: Far from the ocean and heavily forested but with plenty of rivers and open space for maneuvers.

values.name: islands
values.description: Each player starts alone on an island; uninhabited islands may be rich with resources so be prepared to rule the sea.

values.name: mediterranean
values.description: An inland sea surrounded by land; sounds deceptively peaceful.

values.name: migration
values.description: A tiny island that can't support you for long before you must move to the mainland, where the fighting is fierce.

values.name: mongolia
values.description: Cliffs abound on these parched and endless steppes.

values.name: oasis
values.description: Nearly all the wood is in the center of the map, so prepare to be chased around and around.

values.name: rivers
values.description: Players are isolated by narrow rivers; numerous shallows must be guarded at all cost.

values.name: salt-marsh
values.description: Swampy lowlands full of shallows and rivers that can prohibit expansionistic building.

values.name: scandanavia
values.description: In the northern wilderness the berry bushes have all but frozen, but there are hungry animals to be hunted and plenty of gold to be found.

values.name: team-islands
values.description: Each team is placed on their own island. The map is mostly water with some land.

values.name: yucatan
values.description: "In the tropical rainforest food is abundant, but jaguars stalk beneath the canopy"

values.name: UP-MICHI-STYLE
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the map is Michi style (requires a 1.1 compatible RMS script). Michi style maps have a wall of resources (usually trees) blocking the players off so it takes time to be attacked.

values.name: UP-NOMAD-STYLE
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if it is a Nomad style map. Nomad style maps are when you do not start with a Town Center, and must build one somewhere on the map to start villager production

values.name: c:%*
values.description: UP math percentage operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:%* b` computes `a * (b / 100)` storing the result in a

values.name: c:%/
values.description: UP math inverse percentage operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:%/ b` computes `a / (b / 100)` storing the result in a

values.name: c:*
values.description: UP multiplication operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:* b` computes `a * b` storing the result in a

values.name: c:+
values.description: UP addition operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:+ b` computes `a + b` storing the result in a

values.name: c:-
values.description: UP subtraction operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:- b` computes `a - b` storing the result in a

values.name: c:/
values.description: UP division operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:/ b` computes `a / b` storing the result in a

values.name: c:=
values.description: UP assignment operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:= b` stores the value of b in a

values.name: c:max
values.description: UP maximum operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:max b` stores the larger of the two values (a,b) into a

values.name: c:mod
values.description: UP remainder operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:mod b` computes `mod(a/b)` storing the result in a

values.name: c:min
values.description: UP minimum operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:min b` stores the smaller of the two values (a,b) into a

values.name: c:neg
values.description: UP negation operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:max b` stores the negative of b into a

values.name: c:z/
values.description: UP `divide and round down` operator (constants). Example: `up-modify-goal a c:z/ b` stores `floor(a/b)` into a

values.name: g:%*
values.description: UP math percentage operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:%* b` computes `a * (b / 100)` storing the result in a

values.name: g:%/
values.description: UP math inverse percentage operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:%/ b` computes `a / (b / 100)` storing the result in a

values.name: g:*
values.description: UP multiplication operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:* b` computes `a * b` storing the result in a

values.name: g:+
values.description: UP addition operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:+ b` computes `a + b` storing the result in a

values.name: g:-
values.description: UP subtraction operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:- b` computes `a - b` storing the result in a

values.name: g:/
values.description: UP division operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:/ b` computes `a / b` storing the result in a

values.name: g:=
values.description: UP assignment operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:= b` stores the value of b in a

values.name: g:max
values.description: UP maximum operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:max b` stores the larger of the two values (a,b) into a

values.name: g:mod
values.description: UP remainder operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:mod b` computes `mod(a/b)` storing the result in a

values.name: g:min
values.description: UP minimum operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:min b` stores the smaller of the two values (a,b) into a

values.name: g:neg
values.description: UP negation operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:max b` stores the negative of b into a

values.name: g:z/
values.description: UP `divide and round down` operator (goals). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:z/ b` stores `floor(a/b)` into a

values.name: s:%*
values.description: UP math percentage operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:%* b` computes `a * (b / 100)` storing the result in a

values.name: s:%/
values.description: UP math inverse percentage operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:%/ b` computes `a / (b / 100)` storing the result in a

values.name: s:*
values.description: UP multiplication operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:* b` computes `a * b` storing the result in a

values.name: s:+
values.description: UP addition operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:+ b` computes `a + b` storing the result in a

values.name: s:-
values.description: UP subtraction operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:- b` computes `a - b` storing the result in a

values.name: s:/
values.description: UP division operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:/ b` computes `a / b` storing the result in a

values.name: s:=
values.description: UP assignment operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:= b` stores the value of b in a

values.name: s:max
values.description: UP maximum operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:max b` stores the larger of the two values (a,b) into a

values.name: s:mod
values.description: UP remainder operator (strategic-numbers). Example: `up-modify-goal a g:mod b` computes `mod(a/b)` storing the result in a

ObjectData.description: Data associated with a given object

values.name: object-data-tasks-count
values.description: Object tasks count (increased for internal tasks performed on the object, i.e. may be more than 1 per event)

values.name: object-data-attacker-count
values.description: Object number of attackers (note increased for certain situations like hunting)

values.name: object-data-attacker-id
values.description: Object attacker ID (not set for situations like hunting)

values.name: object-data-under-attack
values.description: Object is under attack (not set for certian situations like hunting)

values.name: object-data-attack-timer
values.description: Object timer that resets to 60s for each attack (buildings only)

values.name: object-data-on-mainland
values.description: Object is on the mainland (compares map-zone-id to home TC map-zone-id)

values.name: object-data-next-attack
values.description: Time until object's next attack (in milliseconds)

values.name: object-data-target-time
values.description: Object target time (in milliseconds, not for villagers)

values.name: object-data-gather-type
values.description: food, wood, gold, stone or -1 for none

values.name: object-data-language-id
values.description: Can be used to check villager types

values.name: object-data-group-flag
values.description: Group ID from 0-9 or -2 for none

values.name: object-data-hero
values.description: Object has actual hero flag set

values.name: object-data-frame-delay
values.description: Number of frames for projectile delay

values.name: object-data-to-precise
values.description: Precise distance to a precise target-point

ObjectId.description: Object ID, consisting of UnitIds and BuildingIds

Perimeter.description: Defines a given perimeter distance from starting town-center

values.description: Between 10 and 20 tiles from the starting Town Center
Between 18 and 30 tiles from the starting Town Center

PlayerId.description: A player ID or wildcard string

values.name: every-ally
values.description: All allied players, computer and human

values.name: every-enemy
values.description: Every enemy player, computer or human

values.name: every-neutral
values.description: Every neutral stanced player, computer and human

values.name: focus-player
values.description: (Userpatch only) Linked with player number specified in sn-focus-player-num

PlayerSettings.description: User patch settings related to players

values.name: UP-1-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User patch only. Defined if there a total of 1 players at the start of the game (only really possible in scenarios)

values.name: UP-1-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 1 player on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you are solo). Generally FFA games start this way, although they tend to be rare in AOE2

values.name: UP-2-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 2 players at the start of the game.

values.name: UP-2-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 2 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 1 ally)

values.name: UP-3-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 3 players at the start of the game

values.name: UP-3-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 3 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 2 allies)

values.name: UP-4-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 4 players at the start of the game

values.name: UP-4-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 4 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 3 allies)

values.name: UP-5-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 5 players at the start of the game

values.name: UP-5-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 5 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 4 allies)

values.name: UP-6-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 6 players at the start of the game

values.name: UP-6-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 6 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 5 allies)

values.name: UP-7-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 7 players at the start of the game

values.name: UP-7-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 7 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 6 allies)

values.name: UP-8-PLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 8 players at the start of the game

values.name: UP-8-PLAYER-TEAM
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a total of 8 players on the AIs team when the game starts (ie; you have 7 allies. This usually can be the case in Wonder Race games with 8 players)

values.name: UP-PLAYER-1
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 1

values.name: UP-PLAYER-2
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 2

values.name: UP-PLAYER-3
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 3

values.name: UP-PLAYER-4
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 4

values.name: UP-PLAYER-5
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 5

values.name: UP-PLAYER-6
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 6

values.name: UP-PLAYER-7
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 7

values.name: UP-PLAYER-8
values.description: Defined if the AI is player 8

values.name: UP-COLOR-1
values.description: Defined if the AI is blue

values.name: UP-COLOR-2
values.description: Defined if the AI is red

values.name: UP-COLOR-3
values.description: Defined if the AI is green

values.name: UP-COLOR-4
values.description: Defined if the AI is yellow

values.name: UP-COLOR-5
values.description: Defined if the AI is teal

values.name: UP-COLOR-6
values.description: Defined if the AI is purple

values.name: UP-COLOR-7
values.description: Defined if the AI is grey

values.name: UP-COLOR-8
values.description: Defined if the AI is orange

values.name: UP-ALLY-IN-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a is at least 1 player allied to the AIs when the game starts.

values.name: UP-AVAILABLE
values.description: Defined if User Patch is available at all.

values.name: UP-AZTEC-CIV-ALLY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Aztec ally. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-AZTEC-CIV-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Aztec enemy. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-BRITON-CIV-ALLY

values.name: UP-BYZANTINE-CIV-ENEMY

values.name: UP-PERSIAN-CIV-ENEMY

values.name: UP-SARACEN-CIV-ALLY

values.name: UP-SPANISH-CIV-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Spanish enemy. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-TEUTONIC-CIV-ALLY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Teutonic ally. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-TEUTONIC-CIV-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Teutonic enemy. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-TURKISH-CIV-ALLY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Turkish ally. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-TURKISH-CIV-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Turkish enemy. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-VIKING-CIV-ALLY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Viking ally. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-VIKING-CIV-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts with an Viking enemy. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-GAME-AGE2-X2
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the game is the mod Forgotten Empires.

values.name: UP-HUMAN-IN-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if there a is at least 1 human player in the game.

values.name: UP-HUMAN-ALLY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if a human ally exists

values.name: UP-HUMAN-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if a human enemy exists

values.name: UP-COMPUTER-ALLY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if a computer ally exists

values.name: UP-COMPUTER-ENEMY
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if a computer enemy exists

values.name: UP-MULTIPLAYER-GAME
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if this is a multiplayer game (conversely will be a singleplayer game of some sort if not defined)

values.name: UP-MULTIPLE-ENEMIES
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI has 2 or more enemies at the start of the game. Note without TEAMS-LOCKED this may become false later in the game

values.name: UP-NOMAD-STYLE
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if it is a Nomad style map. Nomad style maps are when you do not start with a Town Center, and must build one somewhere on the map to start villager production

values.name: UP-POCKET-POSITION
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI is in a pocket position (not on the flank of their team). This means they are flanked by two allies and are not adjacent to any enemies. This will only be defined for teams of 3 or more players

values.name: UP-TEAM-DISADVANTAGE
values.description: User Patch only. Defined if the AI starts on a smaller team. This is defined to be if the team the AI is on has any team larger than it, it will be true

values.name: UP-VERSION-1.1
values.description: Defined if User Patch version 1.1 is available. Future patch versions will feature as new symbols.

values.name: UP-VERSION-1.5
values.description: Defined if User Patch version 1.5 is available.

values.name: POPULATION-CAP-200
note: For user patch versions this will be true for all pop caps above 200
Pair with `#load-if-not-defined POPULATION-CAP-EXTENDED` to make sure pop cap is exactly 200

values.name: POPULATION-CAP-EXTENDED
values.description: True if population cap allows for pop caps above 200
note: This symbol is defined for any population-cap greater than 200

ResourceAmount.description: Returns amount of a given resource/property

ResearchState.description: Valid states of a given research tech

values.name: research-available
values.description: Checks that the given research is available to computer player's civ, and research is available at this time (tech tree prerequisites are met).

values.name: research-complete
values.description: This fact checks that the given research is completed.

values.name: research-unavailable
values.description: Checks given research is unavailable to computer player's civ, or research is unavailable at this time (tech tree prerequisites are not met).

ResourceId.description: A valid resource (food, wood, stone, gold)

values.name: boar-hunting
values.description: Resource identifier specifically for boar hunting
notes: References newest boar regardless of alive or dead state
See live-boar for resource identifier which applies to living boars

values.name: deer-hunting
notes: Will be 255 when exusted/unscouted or when it is unreachable (such as on another island) instead of normal resources which when in this state are -1.

values.name: hunting
values.description: Resource identifier for either dear or boar hunting, whichever is closest
notes: Resource identifier for deer or boar hunting (whichever is closest or defined by `sn-enable-boar-hunting`)
Will be 255 when exausted/unscouted or when deer/boar are unreachable

values.name: action-unload
values.description: Buildings ungarrison to gather point, siege (913) eject in-place, transports to target-point

values.name: action-ungarrison
values.description: Selected units from inside an object are ungarrisoned
All hail, king of the losers!
I'll beat you back to Age of Empires
Sure, blame it on your ISP
Don't point that thing at me!
It is good to be the king
My granny could scrap better than that
The wonder, the wonder, the ... no!
You played two hours to die like this?
Yeah, well, you should see the other guy
Wait for my signal to attack

values.name: timer-triggered
values.description: Checks whether a given timer has triggered

values.name: c:!=
values.description: UP comparison 'not equal to' operator (constants). Equivalent to `!=`

values.name: c:>
values.description: UP `greater than` comparison operator (constants). Equivalent to `>`

values.name: c:>=
values.description: UP `greater than equal to` comparison operator (constants). Equivalent to `>=`

values.name: c:<
values.description: UP `less than` comparison operator (constants). Equivalent to `<`

values.name: c:<=
values.description: UP `less than equal to` comparison operator (constants). Equivalent to `<=`

values.name: c:==
values.description: UP equality operator (constants). Example: `up-compare-goal a c:== b` returns true if a equals b

values.name: g:!=
values.description: UP comparison 'not equal to' operator (goals). Equivalent to `!=`

values.name: g:>
values.description: UP `greater than` comparison operator (goals). Equivalent to `>`

values.name: g:>=
values.description: UP `greater than equal to` comparison operator (goals). Equivalent to `>=`

values.name: g:<
values.description: UP `less than` comparison operator (goals). Equivalent to `<`

values.name: g:<=
values.description: UP `less than equal to` comparison operator (goals). Equivalent to `<=`

values.name: g:==
values.description: UP equality operator (goals). Example: `up-compare-goal a g:== b` returns true if a equals b

values.name: s:!=
values.description: UP comparison 'not equal to' operator (strategic numbers). Equivalent to `!=`

values.name: s:>
values.description: UP `greater than` comparison operator (strategic numbers). Equivalent to `>`

values.name: s:>=
values.description: UP `greater than equal to` comparison operator (strategic numbers). Equivalent to `>=`

values.name: s:<
values.description: UP `less than` comparison operator (strategic numbers). Equivalent to `<`

values.name: s:<=
values.description: UP `less than equal to` comparison operator (strategic numbers). Equivalent to `<=`

values.name: s:==
values.description: UP equality operator (strategic numbers). Example: `up-compare-goal a s:== b` returns true if a equals b

VictoryCond.description: Victory conditions for random map games

values.name: conquest
values.description: Must destroy all enemy military and villager units and buildings

values.name: custom
values.description: Defined by the map being played

values.name: regicide
values.description: Start with 1 king, 1 castle, 7 extra villagers (resources: food=500, wood=500, gold=0, stone=150)

values.name: time-limit
values.description: The game will end after a specified time

VictoryCondSetting.description: Value of victory condition for use with `#load-if-(not-)defined`

values.name: and
values.description: Used to check if two Facts are BOTH true

param.note: A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
An identifier for the
A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`

values.name: defrule
values.description: Defines the start of a new rule

param.note: none

values.name: #else
values.description: Loads the enclosing code if the associated `#load-if-(not-)defined` is not satisfied

param.note: none
none

values.name: load
note: Takes a single filename of form 'relative/path/to/file' without the '.per' extension.
Path is relative to the top `.ai` file

param.note: A single filename of form 'relative/path/to/file' without the '.per' extension

values.name: load-random
values.description: Load a file with some random chance
note: Takes a single filename of form 'relative/path/to/file' without the '.per' extension.
Path is relative to the top `.ai` file
For Userpatch, add a `+` before the constant to apply load only for Userpatch

param.note: A valid setting for the game
A single filename of form 'relative/path/to/file' without the '.per' extension

example.title: Always load a specified file on 1.1
Only load a specified file `load-percent-const`% of the time
This will not work, since a `defconst` defined constant is required

values.name: #load-if-defined
values.description: Loads the enclosing code if condition is true (conditional code must be followed by `#end-if`)
note: Takes a single condition, such as 'HUN-CIV' or 'BLACK-FOREST-MAP

param.note: A valid setting for the game

values.name: #load-if-not-defined
values.description: Loads the enclosing code if condition is false
note: Takes a single condition, such as 'HUN-CIV' or 'BLACK-FOREST-MAP

param.note: A valid setting for the game

values.name: nand
values.description: Checks two Facts and evaluates to 'false' if BOTH facts are 'true' (logical opposite of 'and')

param.note: A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`

values.name: nor
values.description: Checks two Facts and evaluates to 'true' if BOTH facts are 'false' (logical opposite of 'or')

param.note: A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`

values.name: not
values.description: Checks a single Fact and evaluates to 'true' if Fact is 'false'

param.note: A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`

values.name: or
values.description: Used to check if at least one of two Facts is true

param.note: A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
A valid fact command and it's parameters within `()`
